pros:

Benefits

review_title: Rewarding job helping students; Horrid politics internally though.
pros:
-Coworkers (!)
-Helping community/students
-Hours
-Benefits are very good for Flagstaff
cons:
-Demanding faculty who act like the students they teach (most have only had this job after college so they lack experience in the real world)
-State/County budget issues result in short-staffed departments (most can only put out fires - there's no ability to plan because you're busy just keeping things afloat)
-Cliques of faculty glom together to force changes they want, disregarding others' views
-Administration doesn't have a clear picture of what's happening at the direct-student-contact-level
-Managers (called "Directors") are all friends. They will not consider dissenting views from anyone lower than them. 
-Pigeon-holed into positions (several staff members can't move to other areas of the college b/c of personal opinions of their managers and/or because the manager doesn't want to lose the person, so they get stuck in a dead-end job)

pros: Great faculty and staff. Nice facilities. Beautiful environment.
cons: Where do I start? Low pay, especially considering the hours put in. I taught technology and worked typically from 9:30 a.m. to 9:30 p.m. M-Th and put in a lot of time on Fridays and the weekends for meetings and continuous prep. Last year, I tracked my hours = 2375 for a 9-month contract. I love teaching, but received continuous snarky remarks from supervisor over the 4 years. For example, I arrived late to an 8 a.m. Friday meeting after having taught until 9 p.m. on Thursday. Was docked 1 1/2 hours of sick time (by the way, this is illegal). Quit in continuous frustration with verbal abuse and crappy management. Horrid environment .. the worst I've been associated with in 35 years. Way to go CCC!

pros:
Great co-workers
Wonderful mission
Amazing students
Fulfilling work
Good benefits
Amazing time off

CCC has wonderful personnel who have an amazing amount of talent. Management DOES listen and takes everything to heart, especially with the new leadership in 2016. Co-workers care about what they do and about helping out the community at large.
cons: Government support in Arizona of community colleges is terrible. There is a fear that the College will have to make additional cuts in order to survive. It is hard to promote from within and it's difficult to get raises, but that's a product of government work. There are also a lot of people in academia who have not worked outside of such an institution, and there is some gossip and childish behavior because of the size of staff.

review_title: A Friendly place to work, a poor place to advance
job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Flagstaff, AZ
pros: Coconino Community College is a wonderful learning environment for students and good place to start a career, with faculty and staff lending help when needed.
cons: CCC lacks the foresight in mentoring talent when its at hand and suppresses innovative thought when its displayed or attempted.

review_title: Workplace dynamics created a challenging and sometimes rewarding environment
job_title: Senior Systems Analyst in Flagstaff, AZ
pros:
The People where always a joy to work with.
The educational opportunities where many.
The Lifestyle was wonderful.
cons:
Departmental directions where sketchy.
Management styles where diverse.

pros: Supportive administration, cohesive staff, promotes work life balance.
cons: Mid level management needs leadership training.
